Package gov.tak.api.events

Interface IGlobeEvent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GlobeEvent
    public interface IGlobeEvent
    Interface for event capturing change to globe interaction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int BUTTON_LEFT
      Bit signifying left mouse-button involvement
      static int BUTTON_MIDDLE
      Bit signifying middle mouse-button involvement
      static int BUTTON_RIGHT
      Bit signifying right mouse-button involvement
      static java.lang.String CLICK
      A pointer performed a click gesture on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String DOUBLE_CLICK
      A pointer performed a double-click gesture on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String DRAGGING
      A pointer changed position on the globe/target while in a pressed/down state
      static java.lang.String LONG_PRESS
      A pointer performed a long-press gesture on the globe/target
      static int MAIN_POINTER_ID
      The ID of the main pointer for the platform.
      static java.lang.String POINTER_ENTER
      A pointer entered region on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String POINTER_EXIT
      A pointer left a region on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String POINTER_HOVER
      A pointer, device permitting, changed position on the globe/target while in a released/up state
      static java.lang.String PRESS
      A pointer changed to down/pressed state on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String RELEASE
      A pointer changed to a released/up state on the globe/target
      static java.lang.String VIEW_CHANGING
      The position of the camera defining the globe view has changed

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        java.lang.String getType()
        The type globe event
        Returns:
        unique event type String

      • getSource

        java.lang.Object getSource()
        The source object the event originated
        Returns:
        the event source

      • isHandled

        boolean isHandled()
        If the application has handled the globe event
        Returns:
        true if handled

      • setHandled

        void setHandled​(boolean handled)
        Set whether the application has handled the globe event
        Parameters:
        handled - true if handled

      • getPointerId

        int getPointerId()
        Get a number that uniquely identifies the pointer involved in the globe interaction. This may be a mouse cursor or touch depending on the platform. If the pointing device has buttons, getButtons() returns a bitfield describing the press/release states of each button.
        Returns:
        unique pointer identifier int

      • getButtons

        int getButtons()
        Get a bitfield which signifies button involvement. For DRAG events, this is all pressed buttons. For PRESS and RELEASE events this is just the button involved (if any).
        Returns:
        bitfield of involved buttons

      • getGlobeCoordinate

        IGeoPoint getGlobeCoordinate()
        Get the globe coordinate of the globe interaction
        Returns:
        ILocation instance of globe coordinate

      • getGlobeId

        int getGlobeId()
        Get the unique number that distinguishes which globe the interaction is associated
        Returns:
        unique globe ID

      • getViewPosition

        PointF getViewPosition()
        Get the position in view space of the globe interaction
        Returns:
        PointF instance of view position

      • getTargetCount

        int getTargetCount()
        Get the number of targets associated with the event. Targets are ordered descending as defined by the implemented hit detection.
        Returns:
        number of targets

      • getTargetObject

        java.lang.Object getTargetObject​(int targetIndex)
        Get the object at the target index. Targets are ordered descending as defined by the implemented hit detection.
        Parameters:
        targetIndex - the index of the target
        Returns:
        the object at the given target index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if targetIndex index is outside the array index bounds with an array length of getTargetCount()

      • getTargetCoordinate

        IGeoPoint getTargetCoordinate​(int targetIndex)
        Get the coordinate at the target index. Targets are ordered descending as defined by the implemented hit detection.
        Parameters:
        targetIndex - the index of the target
        Returns:
        ILocation instance at the given target index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if targetIndex index is outside of the array index bounds with an array length of getTargetCount()

      • clone

        IGlobeEvent clone()
        Create a copy of this globe event that is guaranteed to be outside of any recycling scheme and safe to cache.
        Returns:
        copy of the globe event
